name: Native360 Loan Fund
address: 2550 N. Diers Ave., Suite K, Grand Island, NE 68803
category: American-Indian-owned Business plan writing in Nebraska
description: Native360 Loan Fund is a Native American Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) that provides affordable credit, capital, technical assistance, and business plan consulting and development services to Native American business owners in Nebraska, Iowa, and South Dakota
services: American-Indian-owned Business plan writing in Nebraska consultation

name: Nebraska Indian Community College APEX Accelerator
category: American-Indian-owned Business plan writing in Nebraska
description: The Nebraska Indian Community College APEX Accelerator provides education and training to help businesses, including Native American businesses, participate in federal, state, and local government contracts. They offer guidance on business planning and other services
services: American-Indian-owned Business plan writing in Nebraska consultation

name: Ho Chunk Community Capital, Inc.
address: Information not available. (Serves the Winnebago reservation and neighboring communities)
category: American-Indian-owned Business plan writing in Nebraska
description: Ho Chunk Community Capital provides low-interest loans and technical assistance to Native entrepreneurs, including business plan templates and reviews, financial analysis, and assistance with organizing under state or tribal business codes
services: American-Indian-owned Business plan writing in Nebraska consultation

name: Turtle Island Trade Coalition
address: University of Nebraska–Lincoln, Lincoln, NE (Specific office address not provided)
category: American-Indian-owned Business plan writing in Nebraska
description: This initiative provides business development aid and resources for Indigenous entrepreneurs, including support for grant applications, setting up online selling sites, and consultation with program coordinators

name: Nebraska Small Business Development Centers (SBDC)

category: American-Indian-owned Business plan writing in Nebraska
description: SBDCs offer resources and consultation for small business creation and expansion in Nebraska, often at no or low cost. They can assist with business plan development

name: GROW Nebraska
category: American-Indian-owned Business plan writing in Nebraska
description: GROW Nebraska is a non-profit organization focused on sustainable economic development by supporting entrepreneurs and small businesses through promotion, market access, and education

name: Nebraska Enterprise Fund (NEF)
category: American-Indian-owned Business plan writing in Nebraska
description: NEF supports Nebraska micro and small businesses by providing capital, training, and technical assistance. They are listed as a minority-owned business resource, including for Native Americans

name: Hozhonigo Consulting LLC
category: American-Indian-owned Business plan writing in Nebraska

While not exclusively business plan writing, their strategic planning services would be relevant
